title: unable to boot instance (Error: novalid host )

comments.content:

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~anil-benny

comments.content: Hi Anil Benny, the 'NoValidHost' error occurs in nova-scheduler, so you may check the log of nova-scheduler and attach it, and the reason at lots of times may there are not enough resource(vcpus, memory, disk) or the compute service is stop or timeout(especially when you just have one compute node)
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hzwangpan

comments.content:
-----------------------
nova-scheduler logs
-----------------------

comments.content:
2013-03-01 01:23:51.296 ^[[01;31mERROR nova.conductor.api [^[[01;36mreq-24be206d-ff79-4ef4-bc0e-41679575bee7 ^[[00;36mNone None^[[01;31m] ^[[01;35m^[[01;31mTimed out waiting for nova-conductor. Is it running? Or did this service start before nova-conductor?^
I saw this error in your compute log, and the scheduler log is not enough to find problem.
You may first check the nova-conductor process is OK or not. and more scheduler log is better.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hzwangpan

comments.content: I'm convering this bug into a question.  Hopefully someone can continue to help you debug your setup there.  Thanks!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~russellb
